intro: Castalia biradiata, commonly known as the two-rayed castalia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, pale green or white flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Castalia biradiata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
